and.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used to join two words, phrases etc referring to things that are related in some way
and.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: He’s gone to get some fish and chips.
The film starred Jack Lemmon and Shirley Maclaine.
We’ve dealt with items one, two, and eleven.
He was tall, dark, and handsome.
He plays the guitar and sings folk songs.
She didn’t speak to anyone and nobody spoke to her.
and.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used to say that one action or event follows another
and.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Sit down and tell me all about it.
She picked up the kitten and put it in the box.
He knocked on the door and went in.
You’ll have to wait and see what happens.
and.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used to say that something is caused by something else
and.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: I missed supper and I’m starving!
She fell downstairs and broke her leg.
and.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: used after verbs such as ‘go’, ‘come’, and ‘try’ to show what your intention is
and.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Shall we go and have a cup of coffee?
I’ll see if I can try and persuade her to come.
and.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: used to introduce a statement, remark, question etc
and.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: And now I’d like to introduce our next speaker, Mrs Thompson.
‘She’s getting married in June.’ ‘And who’s the lucky man?’
and.translation[0].definitions[5].note_b: In written English, avoid starting a sentence with and:
and.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: used between repeated words to emphasize what you are saying
and.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: More and more people are losing their jobs.
We waited for hours and hours!
That was years and years ago.
and.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: used before saying the part of a large number which is less than 100
and.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: by the year two thousand and ten
and.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: used when saying a number which consists of a whole number followed by a fraction
and.translation[0].definitions[8].exampl: in about two and a half hours’ time
five and a quarter per cent
and.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: used between repeated plural nouns to say that some things of a particular kind are much better than others
and.translation[0].definitions[9].exampl: ‘They said this guy was an expert.’ ‘Yes, but there are experts and experts.’
and.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: used when you want someone to add something to what they have just said
and.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: ‘I’m sorry.’ ‘And?’ ‘And I promise it won’t happen again.’
